title: Ben Foden once rubbished The X Factor as 'terrible TV'
text:
Try Star, everyone’s soon-to-be favourite rugby singing group (Picture: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

How the tide turns.

Ben Foden, the ex-England rugby player, is one of the contestants on this year’s The X Factor: Celebrity, which kicks off on ITV tomorrow (12 October).

Foden has teamed up with Bath Rugby player Levi Davis and ex-Scotland (and Strictly Come Dancing alumnus) full-back Thom Evans to form the all-singing rugby ‘supergroup’ Try Star for the celebrity series.

But has taking part in the X Factor always been something of a dream opportunity for Foden?

Well, no.

Did Nicole Scherzinger just Meow????? Very weird??? X factor seems to be on the way out.. . . . terrible TV — Ben Foden (@ben_foden) October 30, 2011

Of course, opinions can change, but back in October 2011 Foden freely admitted on Twitter that the X Factor ‘seems to be on the way out’ – which, to be fair, isn’t totally untrue.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But he also called it ‘terrible TV’, which might’ve raised at least a few eyebrows at ITV when they booked Foden for the new celebrity version of the show.

It’s not like Foden would’ve known that, nearly 8 years to the day he tweeted the above post, he’d be taking to the X Factor stage himself – but then look where we are now…

Ben’s on the mic (Picture: Tony Marshall/Getty Images)

Foden’s bandmate Evans recently explained that the two of them had been singing together since they first met at the age of 16.

‘Ben and I have known each other since we were 16, and we were pretty much singing in the back of a car since 16, on our way to rugby training,’ he explained.

‘So, that dream started then.’

Should the Try Star dream disappear on The X Factor: Celebrity, though, you wouldn’t put it past the likes of Simon Cowell to turn Foden’s previous Twitter comments on their head…

X Factor: Celebrity starts this Saturday at 8.35pm on ITV.
